item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Thursday, September 26, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Rewriting Rust (39 points | 14 comments)
2. How I Built “The Monospace Web” (8 points | 2 comments)
3. Eliminating memory safety vulnerabilities at the source (37 points | 12 comments)
4. Mozilla faces a privacy complaint over Firefox's tracking (23 points | 20 comments)
5. Whence '\n'? (77 points | 19 comments)
6. Fedify 1.0.0 released (18 points | no comments)
7. Frog Protocols announced to try and speed up Wayland protocol development (18 points | 5 comments)
8. nanodjango (35 points | 13 comments)
9. Optimizing Guile Scheme (23 points | 4 comments)
10. The Watermelon Operator (14 points | 6 comments)
11. System Initiative is the Future (10 points | 20 comments)
12. Automattic’s Actionable Misconduct Directed to WP Engine (4 points | no comments)
13. llm-interpolate: Interpolate between embedding points with llm (3 points | no comments)
14. XKCD 1425 (Tasks) turns ten years old today (51 points | 11 comments)
15. similar, but different (6 points | no comments)
16. Why I still blog after 15 years (13 points | 1 comment)
17. Flexing the Windows RRAS BGP implementation (1 points | no comments)
18. Register allocation in the Go compiler (9 points | no comments)
19. Post-OCSP certificate revocation in the Web PKI (7 points | 1 comment)
20. Introducing TODS – a typographic and OpenType default stylesheet (1 points | no comments)
21. mir: Module-level RWX permissions for Node.js (2 points | no comments)
22. Committing to Rust in the kernel (43 points | 17 comments)
23. Severe Unauthenticated RCE Flaw (CVSS 9.9) in GNU/Linux Systems Awaiting Full Disclosure (4 points | 6 comments)
24. Haskell.org and the Haskell Foundation Join Forces (9 points | 2 comments)
25. Bloom: Optimization-Driven Interactive Diagramming (8 points | 1 comment)
